sub_topic: Determining the volume of a sphere.
message_1: A sphere has a radius of 6 cm. What is its volume?
message_2:
To find the volume of a sphere, we use the formula:

Volume = (4/3)πr³

where r is the radius of the sphere.

Given that the radius of the sphere is 6 cm, we can plug this value into the formula:

Volume = (4/3)π(6 cm)³

Volume = (4/3)π(216 cm³)

Volume = (288/3)π cm³

Volume = 96π cm³

The volume of the sphere is approximately 301.59 cubic centimeters (rounded to two decimal places).
